solution_line_template: Charlie owns {charlie_flutes} flute, {charlie_horns} horns, and {charlie_harps} harp for a total of {charlie_flutes}+{charlie_horns}+{charlie_harps}=<<{charlie_flutes}+{charlie_horns}+{charlie_harps}={charlie_total_instruments}>>{charlie_total_instruments} instruments.
Twice as many flutes as Charlie is {carli_flute_multiplier}*{charlie_flutes}=<<{carli_flute_multiplier}*{charlie_flutes}={carli_flutes}>>{carli_flutes} flutes,
Half as many horns as Charlie is {charlie_horns}/{carli_horn_divisor}=<<{charlie_horns}/{carli_horn_divisor}={carli_horns}>>{carli_horns} horn

Therefore, the combined total number of musical instruments owned by Charlie and Carli is {charlie_total_instruments}+{carli_total_instruments}=<<{charlie_total_instruments}+{carli_total_instruments}={combined_total_instruments}>>{combined_total_instruments} instruments.
